pkgmetadata.longdescription: ssh-pymongo-----------Just for convenience. Note: `uri` parameter is assumed as local, after ssh.``pip install ssh-pymongo``Example 1---------.. code:: python from ssh_pymongo import MongoSession session = MongoSession('db.example.com') db = session.connection['db-name']Example 2---------.. code:: python session = MongoSession( host='db.example.com', uri='mongodb://user:password@127.0.0.1/?authSource=admin&authMechanism=SCRAM-SHA-256' ) ... session.stop()Example 3---------.. code:: python session = MongoSession( host='db.example.com', user='myuser', password='mypassword', ) ... session.stop()Example 4---------.. code:: python session = MongoSession( host='db.example.com', port='21', user='myuser', key='/home/myplace/.ssh/id_rsa2', to_port='37017', to_host='0.0.0.0' ) ... session.stop()
